tags.description: Easy, well protected sand, gravel beach. Deep sucking mud at low tide or use stairway access 130 m away to reach cliff top research camp area, cabins.
tags.description:camp: 3 sheltered dreary upland sites along boggy trail under trees or others on cliff top among 9 cabins or shelters with stairway access. Cabins in good condition (2019) so usable if unoccupied.
tags.description:other: Archaeological site. Upland clifftop is occupied occasionally by whale research group Coastal Ecosystems Research Foundation. or possibly abandoned. Loxiwe (clam garden) in cove, so avoid foot traffic and make upland sanitation arrangements.
tags.name: Skull Cove BC Marine Trail Campsite

tags.description: Sheltered, undeveloped. Small campsite at S end of first lagoon to S. on uneven grass. Tidal clearance unknown. Vague reports of better sites on lakes, reached by paddling up creeks, but likely refer to salt lagoons.
tags.description:approach: Easy, mud/rock. Reversing tidal falls. Protected.
tags.description:other: Water at creek. Lagoons to explore. Anchorage at main crossing of waterways.
tags.name: Miles Inlet BC Marine Trail Campsite

tags.description: Protected white sand, mud beach accessible at all tides. Kelp. Camp on beach at most tides or in ~6 cleared sites in forested upland at E end of beach. Water at seasonal creek in NE. Some commercial use. Trail E to First Nations site.
tags.name: Shelter Bay (BCMT)
